attributes.text:
The Tree class implements a tree widget, with collapsible and expandable container nodes and terminal leaf nodes. You instantiate a Tree object and then assign the tree a root folder using the {@link #root} property.

If you don’t want to show the root item, you can hide it with the {@link #hideRoot} property.

The handling of selections within a tree is somewhat distributed between the root tree object and the attached {@link qx.ui.tree.SelectionManager}. To get the currently selected element of a tree use the tree {@link #getSelection} method and tree {@link #setSelection} to set it. The TreeSelectionManager handles more coarse-grained issues like providing {@link #selectAll} and {@link #resetSelection} methods.
This event is fired after a tree item was added to the tree. The {@link qx.event.type.Data#getData} method of the event returns the added item.
Fired on change of the property {@link #openMode}.
Fired on change of the property {@link #root}.
This event is fired after a tree item has been removed from the tree. The {@link qx.event.type.Data#getData} method of the event returns the removed item.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property hideRoot.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyHideRoot}.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property openMode.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyOpenMode}.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property root.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyRoot}.
new value of the property
previous value of the property (null if it was not yet set).

Applies changes of the property value of the property rootOpenClose.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #_applyRootOpenClose}.
Returns the element, to which the content padding should be applied.
The content padding target.
The selection data event.
Event handler for changeSelection events, which opens all parent folders of the selected folders.
key event.
Event handler for key press events. Open and close the current selected item on key left and right press.
The mouse click event object
Event handler for click events, which could change a tree item’s open state.
Returns the tree’s only “external” child, namely the root node.
Array containing the root node
Get the widget, which contains the root tree item. This widget must have a vertical box layout.
the children container

Returns the (computed) value of the property hideRoot.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #hideRoot}.
(Computed) value of hideRoot.
whether children of subfolder should be included
whether invisible children should be included
Returns all children of the tree.
list of children
The tree item to get the item after
Whether invisible/closed tree items should be returned as well.
if true, only the same nest level will be searched
Get the tree item after the given item
The item after the given item. May be null if the item is the last item.

Returns the (computed) value of the property openMode.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #openMode}.
(Computed) value of openMode.
The tree item to get the item before
Whether invisible/closed tree items should be returned as well.
if true, only the same nest level will be searched
Get the tree item before the given item
The item before the given item. May be null if the item is the first item.

Returns the (computed) value of the property root.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #root}.
(Computed) value of root.

Returns the (computed) value of the property rootOpenClose.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #rootOpenClose}.
(Computed) value of rootOpenClose.
The widget to get the containing tree item for.
Returns the tree item, which contains the given widget.
The tree item containing the widget. If the widget is not inside of any tree item null is returned.
Initial value for property hideRoot.

Calls the apply method and dispatches the change event of the property hideRoot with the default value defined by the class developer. This function can only be called from the constructor of a class.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #hideRoot}.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #rootOpenClose}.

Resets the user value of the property hideRoot.

The computed value falls back to the next available value e.g. appearance, init or inheritance value depeneding on the property configuration and value availability.

Toggles the (computed) value of the boolean property rootOpenClose.

For further details take a look at the property definition: {@link #rootOpenClose}.
the new value
Hide the root (Tree) node. This differs from the visibility property in that this property hides only the root node, not the node’s children.
Control whether clicks or double clicks should open or close the clicked folder.
The root tree item of the tree to display

Whether the Root should have an open/close button. This may also be used in conjunction with the hideNode property to provide for virtual root nodes. In the latter case, be very sure that the virtual root nodes are expanded programatically, since there will be no open/close button for the user to open them.
